rows.arabic: الٓمٓصٓ
rows.translation: Alif Lam Mim Sad.
rows.transliteration: alif lām mīm ṣād

bismillah.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.

rows.arabic: كِتَـٰبٌ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكَ فَلَا يَكُن فِى صَدْرِكَ حَرَجٌ مِّنْهُ لِتُنذِرَ بِهِۦ وَذِكْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: This Book has been sent down to you; so do not hesitate to warn (the unbelievers) through it, and remind the faithful.
rows.transliteration: kitābun unzila ilayka falā yakun fī ṣadrika ḥarajun minhu litundhira bihi wadhikrā lil-mu-minīn

rows.arabic: ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مَآ أُنزِلَ إِلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعُوا۟ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ أَوْلِيَآءَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Follow what has been revealed to you by your Lord, and do not follow any other lord apart from Him. Yet little do you care to remember.
rows.transliteration: ittabi`ū mā unzila ilaykum min rabbikum walā tattabi`ū min dūnihi awliyā-a ۗ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَكَم مِّن قَرْيَةٍ أَهْلَكْنَـٰهَا فَجَآءَهَا بَأْسُنَا بَيَـٰتًا أَوْ هُمْ قَآئِلُونَ
rows.translation: Many a habitation have We laid low before: Our retribution came upon them in the night or in the midst of siesta at noon.
rows.transliteration: wakam min qaryatin ahlaknāhā fajā-ahā ba-sunā bayātan aw hum qā-ilūn

rows.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ إِذْ جَآءَهُم بَأْسُنَآ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا كُنَّا ظَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And when Our punishment overtook them they had nothing to say except crying out: "We have indeed been sinners."
rows.transliteration: famā kāna da`wāhum idh jā-ahum ba-sunā illā an qālū innā kunnā ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: فَلَنَسْـَٔلَنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْهِمْ وَلَنَسْـَٔلَنَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
rows.translation: (On the Day of Reckoning) We shall question the people to whom We had sent Our apostles, (if they followed their teachings), and will question the apostles.
rows.transliteration: falanas-alannal ladhīna ursila ilayhim walanas-alannal mursalīn

rows.arabic: فَلَنَقُصَّنَّ عَلَيْهِم بِعِلْمٍ ۖ وَمَا كُنَّا غَآئِبِينَ
rows.translation: We shall recount (their deeds) to them with knowledge, for We were never absent (and saw all they did).
rows.transliteration: falanaquṣṣanna `alayhim bi`il-m ۖ wa mā kunnā ghā-ibīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْوَزْنُ يَوْمَئِذٍ ٱلْحَقُّ ۚ فَمَن ثَقُلَتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: And the weighing will be just on that Day. Then those whose (deeds) are heavier in the balance will find fulfilment,
rows.transliteration: wal waznu yawma-idhinil-ḥaqq ۚ faman thaqulat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

rows.arabic: وَمَنْ خَفَّتْ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ فَأُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: And those whose (deeds) are lighter in the scale shall perish for violating Our signs.
rows.transliteration: wa man khaffat mawāzīnuhu fa-ulā-ikal ladhīna khasirū anfusahum bimā kānū bi-āyātinā yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ مَكَّنَّـٰكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَجَعَلْنَا لَكُمْ فِيهَا مَعَـٰيِشَ ۗ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: We settled you on the earth, and provided means of livelihood for you in it; but little are the thanks you give.
rows.transliteration: walaqad makkannākum fil-arḍi waja`alnā lakum fīhā ma`āyish ۗ qalīlan mā tashkurūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ خَلَقْنَـٰكُمْ ثُمَّ صَوَّرْنَـٰكُمْ ثُمَّ قُلْنَا لِلْمَلَـٰٓئِكَةِ ٱسْجُدُوا۟ لِـَٔادَمَ فَسَجَدُوٓا۟ إِلَّآ إِبْلِيسَ لَمْ يَكُن مِّنَ ٱلسَّـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: Verily We created you and gave you form and shape, and ordered the angels to bow before Adam in homage; and they all bowed but Iblis who was not among those who bowed.
rows.transliteration: walaqad khalaqnākum thumma ṣawwarnākum thumma qulnā lil-malā-ikatis-judū li-ādama fasajadū illā iblīsa lam yakun minas sājidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ مَا مَنَعَكَ أَلَّا تَسْجُدَ إِذْ أَمَرْتُكَ ۖ قَالَ أَنَا۠ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهُ خَلَقْتَنِى مِن نَّارٍ وَخَلَقْتَهُۥ مِن طِينٍ
rows.translation: "What prevented you" (said God), "from bowing (before Adam) at My bidding?" "I am better than him," said he. "You created me from fire, and him from clay."
rows.transliteration: qāla mā mana`aka allā tasjuda idh amartuk ۖ qāla ana khayrun minhu khalaqtanī min nārin wakhalaqtahu min ṭīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَٱهْبِطْ مِنْهَا فَمَا يَكُونُ لَكَ أَن تَتَكَبَّرَ فِيهَا فَٱخْرُجْ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰغِرِينَ
rows.translation: So God said: "Descend. You have no right to be insolent here. Go, and away; you are one of the damned."
rows.transliteration: qāla fahbiṭ minhā famā yakūnu laka an tatakabbara fīhā fakhruj innaka minaṣ ṣāghirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَنظِرْنِىٓ إِلَىٰ يَوْمِ يُبْعَثُونَ
rows.translation: "Grant me respite," said he, "till the raising of the dead."
rows.transliteration: qāla anẓirnī ilā yawmi yub`athūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلْمُنظَرِينَ
rows.translation: And God said: "You have the respite."
rows.transliteration: qāla innaka minal munẓarīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فَبِمَآ أَغْوَيْتَنِى لَأَقْعُدَنَّ لَهُمْ صِرَٰطَكَ ٱلْمُسْتَقِيمَ
rows.translation: "Since You led me into error," said Iblis, "I shall lie in wait for them along Your straight path.
rows.transliteration: qāla fabimā aghwaytanī la-aq`udanna lahum ṣirāṭakal mustaqīm

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ لَـَٔاتِيَنَّهُم مِّنۢ بَيْنِ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمِنْ خَلْفِهِمْ وَعَنْ أَيْمَـٰنِهِمْ وَعَن شَمَآئِلِهِمْ ۖ وَلَا تَجِدُ أَكْثَرَهُمْ شَـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: And I shall come upon them from the front and behind, right and left; and You will not find among them many who would give thanks."
rows.transliteration: thumma la-ātiyannahum min bayni aydīhim wa min khalfihim wa`an aymānihim wa`an shamā-ilihim ۖ walā tajidu aktharahum shākirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱخْرُجْ مِنْهَا مَذْءُومًا مَّدْحُورًا ۖ لَّمَن تَبِعَكَ مِنْهُمْ لَأَمْلَأَنَّ جَهَنَّمَ مِنكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: "Begone," said (God), "contemptible and rejected! As for those who follow you, I shall fill up Hell with all of you.
rows.transliteration: qālakh-ruj minhā madh-ūman mad-ḥūrā ۖ laman tabi`aka minhum la-amla-anna jahannama minkum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: وَيَـٰٓـَٔادَمُ ٱسْكُنْ أَنتَ وَزَوْجُكَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ فَكُلَا مِنْ حَيْثُ شِئْتُمَا وَلَا تَقْرَبَا هَـٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةَ فَتَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And you, O Adam, and your spouse, live in the Garden and eat your fill wheresoever you like, but do not approach this tree, or you will become iniquitous."
rows.transliteration: wayā-ādamus skun anta wazawjukal jannata fakulā min ḥaythu shi-tumā walā taqrabā hādhihish shajarata fatakūnā minaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: فَوَسْوَسَ لَهُمَا ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ لِيُبْدِىَ لَهُمَا مَا وُۥرِىَ عَنْهُمَا مِن سَوْءَٰتِهِمَا وَقَالَ مَا نَهَىٰكُمَا رَبُّكُمَا عَنْ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلشَّجَرَةِ إِلَّآ أَن تَكُونَا مَلَكَيْنِ أَوْ تَكُونَا مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰلِدِينَ
rows.translation: But Satan suggested (evil) to them, in order to reveal their hidden parts of which they were not aware (till then), and said: "Your Lord has forbidden you (to go near) this tree that you may not become angels or immortal."
rows.transliteration: fawaswasa lahumash shayṭānu liyubdiya lahumā mā wūriya `anhumā min saw-ātihimā waqāla mā nahākumā rabbukumā `an hādhihish shajarati illā an takūnā malakayni aw takūnā minal khālidīn

rows.arabic: وَقَاسَمَهُمَآ إِنِّى لَكُمَا لَمِنَ ٱلنَّـٰصِحِينَ
rows.translation: Then he said to them on oath: "I am your sincere friend;"
rows.transliteration: waqāsamahumā innī lakumā laminan nāṣiḥīn

rows.arabic: فَدَلَّىٰهُمَا بِغُرُورٍ ۚ فَلَمَّا ذَاقَا ٱلشَّجَرَةَ بَدَتْ لَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتُهُمَا وَطَفِقَا يَخْصِفَانِ عَلَيْهِمَا مِن وَرَقِ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ وَنَادَىٰهُمَا رَبُّهُمَآ أَلَمْ أَنْهَكُمَا عَن تِلْكُمَا ٱلشَّجَرَةِ وَأَقُل لَّكُمَآ إِنَّ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنَ لَكُمَا عَدُوٌّ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: And led them (to the tree) by deceit. When they tasted (the fruit) of the tree their disgrace became exposed to them; and they patched the leaves of the Garden to hide it. And the Lord said to them: "Did I not forbid you this tree? And I told you that Satan was your open enemy.
rows.transliteration: fadallāhumā bighurūr ۚ falammā dhāqash shajarata badat lahumā saw-ātuhumā waṭafiqā yakhṣifāni `alayhimā min waraqil jannah ۖ wanādāhumā rabbuhumā alam anhakumā `an tilkumash shajarati wa-aqul lakumā innash shayṭāna lakumā `aduwwun mubīn

rows.arabic: قَالَا رَبَّنَا ظَلَمْنَآ أَنفُسَنَا وَإِن لَّمْ تَغْفِرْ لَنَا وَتَرْحَمْنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "O our Lord, we have wronged ourselves. If You do not forgive us and have mercy upon us, we shall certainly be lost."
rows.transliteration: qālā rabbanā ẓalamnā anfusanā wa in lam taghfir lanā watarḥamnā lanakūnanna minal khāsirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱهْبِطُوا۟ بَعْضُكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ عَدُوٌّ ۖ وَلَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُسْتَقَرٌّ وَمَتَـٰعٌ إِلَىٰ حِينٍ
rows.translation: "Go," said God, "one the antagonist of the other, and live on the earth for a time ordained, and fend for yourselves.
rows.transliteration: qālah-biṭū ba`ḍukum liba`ḍin `aduww ۖ walakum fil-arḍi mustaqarrun wa matā`un ilā ḥīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فِيهَا تَحْيَوْنَ وَفِيهَا تَمُوتُونَ وَمِنْهَا تُخْرَجُونَ
rows.translation: You will live there, and there will you die," He said, "and be raised from there (On the Day of Doom)."
rows.transliteration: qāla fīhā taḥyawna wafīhā tamūtūna wa minhā tukhrajūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ قَدْ أَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْكُمْ لِبَاسًا يُوَٰرِى سَوْءَٰتِكُمْ وَرِيشًا ۖ وَلِبَاسُ ٱلتَّقْوَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ ءَايَـٰتِ ٱللَّهِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: O sons of Adam, We have revealed to you a dress that would both hide your nakedness and be an adornment, but the raiment of piety is best. This is one of the tokens of God: You may haply reflect.
rows.transliteration: yābanī ādama qad anzalnā `alaykum libāsan yuwārī saw-ātikum warīshā ۖ walibāsut taqwā dhālika khayr ۚ dhālika min āyātillāhi la`allahum yadhhakkarūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ لَا يَفْتِنَنَّكُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ كَمَآ أَخْرَجَ أَبَوَيْكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ يَنزِعُ عَنْهُمَا لِبَاسَهُمَا لِيُرِيَهُمَا سَوْءَٰتِهِمَآ ۗ إِنَّهُۥ يَرَىٰكُمْ هُوَ وَقَبِيلُهُۥ مِنْ حَيْثُ لَا تَرَوْنَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ لِلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: O sons of Adam, let not Satan beguile you as he did your parents out of Eden, and made them disrobe to expose their disgrace to them. For he and his host can see you from where you cannot see them. We have made the devils the friends of those who do not believe,
rows.transliteration: yābanī ādama lā yaftinannakumush shayṭānu kamā akhraja abawaykum minal jannati yanzi`u `anhumā libāsahumā liyuriyahumā saw-ātihimā ۗ innahu yarākum huwa waqabīluhu min ḥaythu lā tarawnahum ۗ innā ja`alnash shayāṭīna awliyā-a lilladhīna lā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا فَعَلُوا۟ فَـٰحِشَةً قَالُوا۟ وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهَآ ءَابَآءَنَا وَٱللَّهُ أَمَرَنَا بِهَا ۗ قُلْ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يَأْمُرُ بِٱلْفَحْشَآءِ ۖ أَتَقُولُونَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Who say when they commit shameful acts: "Our ancestors used to do so, and God has enjoined us to do the same." Say to them: "God never enjoins a conduct that is shameful. You impute such lies to God as you do not know."
rows.transliteration: wa idhā fa`alū fāḥishatan qālū wajadnā `alayhā ābā-anā wallāhu amaranā bihā ۗ qul innallāha lā ya-muru bil faḥshā-i ۖ ataqūlūna `alallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ أَمَرَ رَبِّى بِٱلْقِسْطِ ۖ وَأَقِيمُوا۟ وُجُوهَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَٱدْعُوهُ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ ۚ كَمَا بَدَأَكُمْ تَعُودُونَ
rows.translation: Tell them: "My Lord has enjoined piety, devotion in all acts of worship, and calling upon Him with exclusive obedience. For you will be reverted back to what you were (when) created first."
rows.transliteration: qul amara rabbī bil qisṭ ۖ wa-aqīmū wujūhakum `inda kulli masjidin wad`ūhu mukhliṣīna lahud dīn ۚ kamā bada-akum ta`ūdūn

rows.arabic: فَرِيقًا هَدَىٰ وَفَرِيقًا حَقَّ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلضَّلَـٰلَةُ ۗ إِنَّهُمُ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ ٱلشَّيَـٰطِينَ أَوْلِيَآءَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَحْسَبُونَ أَنَّهُم مُّهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: A Section (among them) were guided, a section were bound to go astray, (for) instead of God they took the devils as their friends; yet they think they are on the right path.
rows.transliteration: farīqan hadā wafarīqan ḥaqqa `alayhimuḍ ḍalālah ۗ innahumut-takhadhush shayāṭīna awliyā-a min dūnillāhi wayaḥsabūna annahum muhtadūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ خُذُوا۟ زِينَتَكُمْ عِندَ كُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ وَكُلُوا۟ وَٱشْرَبُوا۟ وَلَا تُسْرِفُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُسْرِفِينَ
rows.translation: O sons of Adam, attire yourselves at every time of worship; eat and drink, but do not be wasteful, for God does not like the prodigals.
rows.transliteration: yābanī ādama khudhū zīnatakum `inda kulli masjidin wakulū washrabū walā tusrifū ۚ innahu lā yuḥibbul musrifīn

rows.arabic: قُلْ مَنْ حَرَّمَ زِينَةَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَخْرَجَ لِعِبَادِهِۦ وَٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ مِنَ ٱلرِّزْقِ ۚ قُلْ هِىَ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا خَالِصَةً يَوْمَ ٱلْقِيَـٰمَةِ ۗ كَذَٰلِكَ نُفَصِّلُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Ask them: "Who forbids you attire that God has given to His creatures, and the good things that He has provided?" Tell them: "They are (meant) for believers in the world, and will be theirs on the Day of Judgement." That is how We explain Our signs to those who know.
rows.transliteration: qul man ḥarrama zīnatallāhil latī akhraja li`ibādihi waṭ ṭayyibāti minar rizq ۚ qul hiya lilladhīna āmanū fil ḥayātid dunyā khāliṣatan yawmal qiyāmah ۗ kadhālika nufaṣṣilul-āyāti liqawmiy ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ رَبِّىَ ٱلْفَوَٰحِشَ مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا وَمَا بَطَنَ وَٱلْإِثْمَ وَٱلْبَغْىَ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَأَن تُشْرِكُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ مَا لَمْ يُنَزِّلْ بِهِۦ سُلْطَـٰنًا وَأَن تَقُولُوا۟ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Tell them: "My Lord has forbidden repugnant acts, whether open or disguised, sin and unjust oppression, associating others with God, of which He has sent down no authority, and saying things of God of which you have no knowledge."
rows.transliteration: qul innamā ḥarrama rabbiyal fawāḥisha mā ẓahara minhā wa mā baṭana wal-ithma wal baghya bighayril ḥaqqi wa-an tushrikū billāhi mā lam yunazzil bihi sulṭānan wa-an taqūlū `alallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَلِكُلِّ أُمَّةٍ أَجَلٌ ۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمْ لَا يَسْتَأْخِرُونَ سَاعَةً ۖ وَلَا يَسْتَقْدِمُونَ
rows.translation: A term is fixed for every people; and when their appointed time is come there will neither be a moment's delay nor haste.
rows.transliteration: walikulli ummatin ajal ۖ fa-idhā jā-a ajaluhum lā yasta-khirūna sā`ah ۖ walā yastaqdimūn

rows.arabic: يَـٰبَنِىٓ ءَادَمَ إِمَّا يَأْتِيَنَّكُمْ رُسُلٌ مِّنكُمْ يَقُصُّونَ عَلَيْكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِى ۙ فَمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰ وَأَصْلَحَ فَلَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا هُمْ يَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: O sons of Adam, when apostles come to you from among you, who convey My messages, then those who take heed and amend will have neither fear nor regret.
rows.transliteration: yābanī ādama immā ya-tiyannakum rusulun minkum yaquṣṣūna `alaykum āyātī famanit-taqā wa-aṣlaḥa falā khawfun `alayhim walā hum yaḥzanūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ عَنْهَآ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: But those who deny Our signs and disdain them, shall belong to Hell, where they will abide for ever.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā wastakbarū `anhā ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābun nār ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: فَمَنْ أَظْلَمُ مِمَّنِ ٱفْتَرَىٰ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا أَوْ كَذَّبَ بِـَٔايَـٰتِهِۦٓ ۚ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ يَنَالُهُمْ نَصِيبُهُم مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُنَا يَتَوَفَّوْنَهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ أَيْنَ مَا كُنتُمْ تَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ قَالُوا۟ ضَلُّوا۟ عَنَّا وَشَهِدُوا۟ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمْ أَنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ كَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Who could be more wicked than he who imputes lies to God or denies His revelations? Such as these will receive what is declared in the Book, and when Our angels come to draw out their souls and ask: "Where are they you worshipped other than God?" They will answer: "They have left us and fled;" and bear witness against themselves for being infidels.
rows.transliteration: faman aẓlamu mimmanif-tarā `alallāhi kadhiban aw kadhhaba bi-āyātih ۚ ulā-ika yanāluhum naṣībuhum minal kitāb ۖ ḥattā idhā jā-at hum rusulunā yatawaffawnahum qālū ayna mā kuntum tad`ūna min dūnillāh ۖ qālū ḍallū `annā washahidū `alā anfusihim annahum kānū kāfirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ فِىٓ أُمَمٍ قَدْ خَلَتْ مِن قَبْلِكُم مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ فِى ٱلنَّارِ ۖ كُلَّمَا دَخَلَتْ أُمَّةٌ لَّعَنَتْ أُخْتَهَا ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا ٱدَّارَكُوا۟ فِيهَا جَمِيعًا قَالَتْ أُخْرَىٰهُمْ لِأُولَىٰهُمْ رَبَّنَا هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ أَضَلُّونَا فَـَٔاتِهِمْ عَذَابًا ضِعْفًا مِّنَ ٱلنَّارِ ۖ قَالَ لِكُلٍّ ضِعْفٌ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: "Enter then the Fire," will God say, "with the past generations of jinns and men." On entering each batch will condemn the other; and when all of them shall have entered one after the other, the last to come will say of those who had come before them: "O our Lord, they are the ones who led us astray; so give them double chastisement in the Fire." He will answer: "For all it will be double; but this you do not know."
rows.transliteration: qālad-khulū fī umamin qad khalat min qablikum minal jinni wal-insi fin nār ۖ kullamā dakhalat ummatun la`anat ukhtahā ۖ ḥattā idhad-dārakū fīhā jamī`an qālat ukhrāhum li-ūlāhum rabbanā hā-ulā-i aḍallūnā fa-ātihim `adhāban ḍi`fan minan nār ۖ qāla likullin ḍi`fun walākin lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَتْ أُولَىٰهُمْ لِأُخْرَىٰهُمْ فَمَا كَانَ لَكُمْ عَلَيْنَا مِن فَضْلٍ فَذُوقُوا۟ ٱلْعَذَابَ بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ
rows.translation: Then the former will say to the latter: "You have no privilege over us. So taste the punishment for what you had done."
rows.transliteration: waqālat ūlāhum li-ukhrāhum famā kāna lakum `alaynā min faḍlin fadhūqul `adhāba bimā kuntum taksibūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ عَنْهَا لَا تُفَتَّحُ لَهُمْ أَبْوَٰبُ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَلَا يَدْخُلُونَ ٱلْجَنَّةَ حَتَّىٰ يَلِجَ ٱلْجَمَلُ فِى سَمِّ ٱلْخِيَاطِ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: Verily for those who deny Our signs and turn away in haughtiness from them, the gates of heaven shall not be opened, nor will they enter Paradise, not till the camel passes through the needle's eye. That is how We requite the transgressors:
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā wastakbarū `anhā lā tufattaḥu lahum abwābus samā-i walā yadkhulūnal jannata ḥattā yalijal jamalu fī sammil khiyāṭ ۚ wakadhālika najzil mujrimīn

rows.arabic: لَهُم مِّن جَهَنَّمَ مِهَادٌ وَمِن فَوْقِهِمْ غَوَاشٍ ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: For them is a flooring of Hell and a covering (of fire). That is how We requite the iniquitous.
rows.transliteration: lahum min jahannama mihādun wa min fawqihim ghawāsh ۚ wakadhālika najziẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَعَمِلُوا۟ ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ لَا نُكَلِّفُ نَفْسًا إِلَّا وُسْعَهَآ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ ۖ هُمْ فِيهَا خَـٰلِدُونَ
rows.translation: As for those who believe and do good, We never burden a soul beyond capacity. They are men of Paradise where they will abide for ever.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna āmanū wa`amiluṣ ṣāliḥāti lā nukallifu nafsan illā wus`ahā ulā-ika aṣ-ḥābul jannah ۖ hum fīhā khālidūn

rows.arabic: وَنَزَعْنَا مَا فِى صُدُورِهِم مِّنْ غِلٍّ تَجْرِى مِن تَحْتِهِمُ ٱلْأَنْهَـٰرُ ۖ وَقَالُوا۟ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى هَدَىٰنَا لِهَـٰذَا وَمَا كُنَّا لِنَهْتَدِىَ لَوْلَآ أَنْ هَدَىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ ۖ لَقَدْ جَآءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ ۖ وَنُودُوٓا۟ أَن تِلْكُمُ ٱلْجَنَّةُ أُورِثْتُمُوهَا بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Whatever the rancour they may have in their hearts We shall (cleanse and) remove. Streams of running water shall ripple at their feet, and they will say: "We are grateful to God for guiding us here. Never would we have been guided if God had not shown us the way. The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth." And the cry shall resound: "This is Paradise you have inherited as meed for your deeds."
rows.transliteration: wanaza`nā mā fī ṣudūrihim min ghillin tajrī min taḥtihimul-anhār ۖ waqālul ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī hadānā lihādhā wa mā kunnā linahtadiya lawlā an hadānallāh ۖ laqad jā-at rusulu rabbinā bil ḥaqq ۖ wanūdū an tilkumul jannatu ūrithtumūhā bimā kuntum ta`malūn

rows.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ أَن قَدْ وَجَدْنَا مَا وَعَدَنَا رَبُّنَا حَقًّا فَهَلْ وَجَدتُّم مَّا وَعَدَ رَبُّكُمْ حَقًّا ۖ قَالُوا۟ نَعَمْ ۚ فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌۢ بَيْنَهُمْ أَن لَّعْنَةُ ٱللَّهِ عَلَى ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: And the inmates of Paradise will call to the residents of Hell: "We have found that the promise made to us by our Lord was true. Have you also found the promise of your Lord to be true?" They will answer: "Yes (it is so)." Then a crier will call from among them: "The curse of God be on the vile,
rows.transliteration: wanādā aṣ-ḥābul jannati aṣ-ḥāban nāri an qad wajadnā mā wa`adanā rabbunā ḥaqqan fahal wajadtum mā wa`ada rabbukum ḥaqqā ۖ qālū na`am ۚ fa-adhhana mu-adhhinun baynahum an la`natullāhi `alaẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَيَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ كَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: "Who obstruct those who follow the path of God and try to make it oblique, who do not believe in the life to come."
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yaṣuddūna `an sabīlillāhi wayabghūnahā `iwajan wahum bil-ākhirati kāfirūn

rows.arabic: وَبَيْنَهُمَا حِجَابٌ ۚ وَعَلَى ٱلْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالٌ يَعْرِفُونَ كُلًّۢا بِسِيمَىٰهُمْ ۚ وَنَادَوْا۟ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَن سَلَـٰمٌ عَلَيْكُمْ ۚ لَمْ يَدْخُلُوهَا وَهُمْ يَطْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: There will be a veil between them, and on the wall will be the men (of al-A'raf) who will recognise everyone by their distinguishing marks, and will call to the inmates of Paradise: "Peace on you," without having entered it themselves though hoping to do so.
rows.transliteration: wabaynahumā ḥijāb ۚ wa`alal-a`rāfi rijālun ya`rifūna kullan bisīmāhum ۚ wanādaw aṣ-ḥābal jannati an salāmun `alaykum ۚ lam yadkhulūhā wahum yaṭma`ūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذَا صُرِفَتْ أَبْصَـٰرُهُمْ تِلْقَآءَ أَصْحَـٰبِ ٱلنَّارِ قَالُوا۟ رَبَّنَا لَا تَجْعَلْنَا مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: When their eyes fall on the inmates of Hell they will say: "O Lord, do not place us in the crowd of the vile."
rows.transliteration: wa idhā ṣurifat abṣāruhum tilqā-a aṣ-ḥābin nāri qālū rabbanā lā taj`alnā ma`al qawmiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلْأَعْرَافِ رِجَالًا يَعْرِفُونَهُم بِسِيمَىٰهُمْ قَالُوا۟ مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنكُمْ جَمْعُكُمْ وَمَا كُنتُمْ تَسْتَكْبِرُونَ
rows.translation: Recognising them by their marks the men of al-A'raf will call (to the inmates of Hell): "Of what use was your amassing (of wealth) of which you were proud?"
rows.transliteration: wanādā aṣ-ḥābul-a`rāfi rijālan ya`rifūnahum bisīmāhum qālū mā aghnā `ankum jam`ukum wa mā kuntum tastakbirūn

rows.arabic: أَهَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ ٱلَّذِينَ أَقْسَمْتُمْ لَا يَنَالُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ ۚ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْجَنَّةَ لَا خَوْفٌ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَآ أَنتُمْ تَحْزَنُونَ
rows.translation: (Then pointing to the inmates of Paradise, they will say): "Are they not those of whom you had sworn and said: 'God will not have mercy on them?' (And yet they have been told,) 'Enter Paradise where you will have no fear or regret.'"
rows.transliteration: ahā-ulā-il ladhīna aqsamtum lā yanāluhumullāhu biraḥmah ۚ ud-khulul jannata lā khawfun `alaykum walā antum taḥzanūn

rows.arabic: وَنَادَىٰٓ أَصْحَـٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ أَصْحَـٰبَ ٱلْجَنَّةِ أَنْ أَفِيضُوا۟ عَلَيْنَا مِنَ ٱلْمَآءِ أَوْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ حَرَّمَهُمَا عَلَى ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Those in Hell will call to the inmates of Paradise: "Pour a little water over us, or give us a little of what God has given you." They will answer: "God has verily forbidden these to those who denied the truth.
rows.transliteration: wanādā aṣ-ḥābun nāri aṣ-ḥābal jannati an afīḍū `alaynā minal mā-i aw mimmā razaqakumullāh ۚ qālū innallāha ḥarramahumā `alal-kāfirīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ دِينَهُمْ لَهْوًا وَلَعِبًا وَغَرَّتْهُمُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ فَٱلْيَوْمَ نَنسَىٰهُمْ كَمَا نَسُوا۟ لِقَآءَ يَوْمِهِمْ هَـٰذَا وَمَا كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يَجْحَدُونَ
rows.translation: "Who made a sport and frolic of their faith and were lured by the life of the world." As they had forgotten the meeting of this Day so shall We neglect them today for having rejected Our signs.
rows.transliteration: alladhīnat-takhadhū dīnahum lahwan wala`iban wagharrat-humul ḥayātud dunyā ۚ fal yawma nansāhum kamā nasū liqā-a yawmihim hādhā wa mā kānū bi-āyātinā yajḥadūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ جِئْنَـٰهُم بِكِتَـٰبٍ فَصَّلْنَـٰهُ عَلَىٰ عِلْمٍ هُدًى وَرَحْمَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed We had brought to them a Book distinct, replete with knowledge, and guidance and grace for men who believe.
rows.transliteration: walaqad ji-nāhum bikitābin faṣṣalnāhu `alā `il-min hudan waraḥmatan liqawmiy yu-minūn

rows.arabic: هَلْ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا تَأْوِيلَهُۥ ۚ يَوْمَ يَأْتِى تَأْوِيلُهُۥ يَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ نَسُوهُ مِن قَبْلُ قَدْ جَآءَتْ رُسُلُ رَبِّنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ فَهَل لَّنَا مِن شُفَعَآءَ فَيَشْفَعُوا۟ لَنَآ أَوْ نُرَدُّ فَنَعْمَلَ غَيْرَ ٱلَّذِى كُنَّا نَعْمَلُ ۚ قَدْ خَسِرُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ وَضَلَّ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَفْتَرُونَ
rows.translation: Are they waiting for the exposition of what it speaks of? The day that (Reality) is unravelled, the people who had lost sight of it will say: "The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth. Do we have any one to intercede for us? If only we could go back to the world, we would act otherwise." Indeed they have caused themselves harm, and the lies they concocted did not help.
rows.transliteration: hal yanẓurūna illā ta-wīlah ۚ yawma ya-tī ta-wīluhu yaqūlul ladhīna nasūhu min qablu qad jā-at rusulu rabbinā bil ḥaqqi fahal lanā min shufa`ā-a fayashfa`ū lanā aw nuraddu fana`mala ghayral ladhī kunnā na`mal ۚ qad khasirū anfusahum waḍalla `anhum mā kānū yaftarūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِى خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ فِى سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ ٱسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلْعَرْشِ يُغْشِى ٱلَّيْلَ ٱلنَّهَارَ يَطْلُبُهُۥ حَثِيثًا وَٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ وَٱلنُّجُومَ مُسَخَّرَٰتٍۭ بِأَمْرِهِۦٓ ۗ أَلَا لَهُ ٱلْخَلْقُ وَٱلْأَمْرُ ۗ تَبَارَكَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Surely your Lord is God who created the heavens and the earth in six spans of time, then assumed all power. He covers up the day with night which comes chasing it fast; and the sun and moon and the stars are subject to His command. It is His to create and enjoin. Blessed be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: inna rabbakumullāhul ladhī khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa fī sittati ayyāmin thummas-tawā `alal-`arshi yughshil laylan nahāra yaṭlubuhu ḥathīthan wash shamsa wal qamara wan nujūma musakhharātin bi-amrih ۗ alā lahul khalqu wal-amr ۗ tabārakallāhu rabbul `ālamīn

rows.arabic: ٱدْعُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ تَضَرُّعًا وَخُفْيَةً ۚ إِنَّهُۥ لَا يُحِبُّ ٱلْمُعْتَدِينَ
rows.translation: Pray to your Lord in humility and unseen. He does not love the iniquitous.
rows.transliteration: ud-`ū rabbakum taḍarru`an wakhufyah ۚ innahu lā yuḥibbul mu`tadīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَـٰحِهَا وَٱدْعُوهُ خَوْفًا وَطَمَعًا ۚ إِنَّ رَحْمَتَ ٱللَّهِ قَرِيبٌ مِّنَ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
rows.translation: And do not corrupt the land after it has been reformed; and pray to Him in awe and expectation. The blessing of God is at hand for those who do good.
rows.transliteration: walā tufsidū fil-arḍi ba`da iṣlāḥihā wad`ūhu khawfan waṭama`ā ۚ inna raḥmatallāhi qarībun minal muḥsinīn

rows.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلَّذِى يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦ ۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَقَلَّتْ سَحَابًا ثِقَالًا سُقْنَـٰهُ لِبَلَدٍ مَّيِّتٍ فَأَنزَلْنَا بِهِ ٱلْمَآءَ فَأَخْرَجْنَا بِهِۦ مِن كُلِّ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُخْرِجُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: Indeed it is He who sends the winds as harbingers of auspicious news announcing His beneficence, bringing heavy clouds which We drive towards a region lying dead, and send down rain, and raise all kinds of fruits. So shall We raise the dead that you may think and reflect.
rows.transliteration: wahuwal ladhī yursilur riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatih ۖ ḥattā idhā aqallat saḥāban thiqālan suqnāhu libaladin mayyitin fa-anzalnā bihil mā-a fa-akhrajnā bihi min kullith thamarāt ۚ kadhālika nukhrijul mawtā la`allakum tadhakkarūn

rows.arabic: وَٱلْبَلَدُ ٱلطَّيِّبُ يَخْرُجُ نَبَاتُهُۥ بِإِذْنِ رَبِّهِۦ ۖ وَٱلَّذِى خَبُثَ لَا يَخْرُجُ إِلَّا نَكِدًا ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نُصَرِّفُ ٱلْـَٔايَـٰتِ لِقَوْمٍ يَشْكُرُونَ
rows.translation: The soil that is good produces (rich) crops by the will of its Lord, and that which is had yields only what is poor. So do We explain Our signs in different ways to people who give thanks.
rows.transliteration: wal baladuṭ ṭayyibu yakhruju nabātuhu bi-idhni rabbih ۖ wal ladhī khabutha lā yakhruju illā nakidā ۚ kadhālika nuṣarriful-āyāti liqawmiy yashkurūn

rows.arabic: لَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَا نُوحًا إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ فَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ إِنِّىٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: We sent Noah to his people, and he said: "O people worship God; you have no other god but He; for I fear the retribution of the great Day may fall on you."
rows.transliteration: laqad arsalnā nūḥan ilā qawmihi faqāla yāqawmi'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruhu innī akhāfu `alaykum `adhāba yawmin `aẓīm

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰكَ فِى ضَلَـٰلٍ مُّبِينٍ
rows.translation: The elders of his people replied: "We see clearly that you have gone astray."
rows.transliteration: qālal-mala-u min qawmihi innā lanarāka fī ḍalālin mubīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِى ضَلَـٰلَةٌ وَلَـٰكِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: "I have not gone astray, O my people," he said, "but have been sent by my Lord, the creator of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi laysa bī ḍalālatun walākinnī rasūlun min rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّى وَأَنصَحُ لَكُمْ وَأَعْلَمُ مِنَ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: I bring to you the messages of my Lord, and give you sincere advice, for I know from God what you do not know.
rows.transliteration: uballighukum risālāti rabbī wa-anṣaḥu lakum wa-a`lamu minallāhi mā lā ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَآءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِيُنذِرَكُمْ وَلِتَتَّقُوا۟ وَلَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
rows.translation: Do you wonder that a warning has come to you from your Lord through a man who is one of you, and warns you to take heed for yourselves and fear God? You might be treated with mercy."
rows.transliteration: awa`ajibtum an jā-akum dhikrun min rabbikum `alā rajulin minkum liyundhirakum walitattaqū wala`allakum turḥamūn

rows.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥ فِى ٱلْفُلْكِ وَأَغْرَقْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا عَمِينَ
rows.translation: But they called him a liar, and We saved him and those with him in the Ark, and drowned the others who rejected Our signs, for they were a people purblind.
rows.transliteration: fakadhhabūhu fa-anjaynāhu wal ladhīna ma`ahu fil fulki wa-aghraqnal ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā ۚ innahum kānū qawman `amīn

rows.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ عَادٍ أَخَاهُمْ هُودًا ۗ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥٓ ۚ أَفَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
rows.translation: And We sent Hud, their brother, to the people of 'Ad. He said: "O you people, worship God, for you have no other god but He. Will you not take heed for yourselves?"
rows.transliteration: wa ilā `ādin akhāhum hūdā ۗ qāla yāqawmi'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruh ۚ afalā tattaqūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِنَّا لَنَرَىٰكَ فِى سَفَاهَةٍ وَإِنَّا لَنَظُنُّكَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
rows.translation: The chiefs of his people who were infidels replied: "We find you full of folly, and a liar to boot."
rows.transliteration: qālal-mala-ul ladhīna kafarū min qawmihi innā lanarāka fī safāhatin wa innā lanaẓunnuka minal kādhibīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لَيْسَ بِى سَفَاهَةٌ وَلَـٰكِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: "I am not a fool, O people," he answered, "but have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds.
rows.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi laysa bī safāhatun walākinnī rasūlun min rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: أُبَلِّغُكُمْ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّى وَأَنَا۠ لَكُمْ نَاصِحٌ أَمِينٌ
rows.translation: I bring to you the messages of my Lord. I am your sincere friend.
rows.transliteration: uballighukum risālāti rabbī wa-ana lakum nāṣiḥun amīn

rows.arabic: أَوَعَجِبْتُمْ أَن جَآءَكُمْ ذِكْرٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَلَىٰ رَجُلٍ مِّنكُمْ لِيُنذِرَكُمْ ۚ وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ قَوْمِ نُوحٍ وَزَادَكُمْ فِى ٱلْخَلْقِ بَصْۜطَةً ۖ فَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Do you wonder that a warning has come to you from your Lord through a man who is one of you and warns you? Remember, He made you leaders after the people of Noah, and gave you a greater increase in your stature. So think of the favours of God; you may haply be blessed."
rows.transliteration: awa`ajibtum an jā-akum dhikrun min rabbikum `alā rajulin minkum liyundhirakum ۚ wadhkurū idh ja`alakum khulafā-a min ba`di qawmi nūḥin wazādakum fil khalqi basṭah ۖ fadhkurū ālā-allāhi la`allakum tufliḥūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَجِئْتَنَا لِنَعْبُدَ ٱللَّهَ وَحْدَهُۥ وَنَذَرَ مَا كَانَ يَعْبُدُ ءَابَآؤُنَا ۖ فَأْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: They answered: "Have you come to say to us that we should worship only one God, abandoning those our ancestors had worshipped? If so, bring on us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true."
rows.transliteration: qālū aji-tanā lina`budallāha waḥdahu wanadhara mā kāna ya`budu ābā-unā ۖ fa-tinā bimā ta`idunā in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ قَدْ وَقَعَ عَلَيْكُم مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ رِجْسٌ وَغَضَبٌ ۖ أَتُجَـٰدِلُونَنِى فِىٓ أَسْمَآءٍ سَمَّيْتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمْ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّا نَزَّلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلْطَـٰنٍ ۚ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓا۟ إِنِّى مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلْمُنتَظِرِينَ
rows.translation: He replied: "You have already been beset with punishment and the wrath of God. Why dispute with me about names invented by you and your ancestors for which no sanction was sent down? So wait (for what is to come), I am waiting with you."
rows.transliteration: qāla qad waqa`a `alaykum min rabbikum rijsun waghaḍab ۖ atujādilūnanī fī asmā-in sammaytumūhā antum wa-ābā-ukum mā nazzalallāhu bihā min sulṭān ۚ fantaẓirū innī ma`akum minal muntaẓirīn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَٱلَّذِينَ مَعَهُۥ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِّنَّا وَقَطَعْنَا دَابِرَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا ۖ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ مُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Then We saved him and those on his side by Our grace, and destroyed to the very last those who rejected Our signs and denied the truth.
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wal ladhīna ma`ahu biraḥmatim minnā waqaṭa`nā dābiral ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā ۖ wa mā kānū mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَـٰلِحًا ۗ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥ ۖ قَدْ جَآءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ هَـٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةُ ٱللَّهِ لَكُمْ ءَايَةً ۖ فَذَرُوهَا تَأْكُلْ فِىٓ أَرْضِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh. "O you people," said he, "worship God, for you have no other god but He. Clear proof has come to you already from your Lord, and this she-camel of God is the token for you. Leave her free to graze upon God's earth, and do not molest her lest a grievous punishment should befall you.
rows.transliteration: wa ilā thamūda akhāhum ṣāliḥā ۗ qāla yāqawmi'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruh ۖ qad jā-at kum bayyinatun min rabbikum ۖ hādhihi nāqatullāhi lakum āyah ۖ fadharūhā ta-kul fī arḍillāh ۖ walā tamassūhā bisū-in faya-khudhakum `adhābun alīm

rows.arabic: وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ جَعَلَكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ عَادٍ وَبَوَّأَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ تَتَّخِذُونَ مِن سُهُولِهَا قُصُورًا وَتَنْحِتُونَ ٱلْجِبَالَ بُيُوتًا ۖ فَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ ءَالَآءَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: Remember, how you were made leaders after the people of 'Ad, and were settled on the land so that you could construct on the plains palaces, and carve dwellings out of mountains. So think of the favours of God, and do not act with corruption in the land."
rows.transliteration: wadhkurū idh ja`alakum khulafā-a min ba`di `ādin wabawwa-akum fil-arḍi tattakhidhūna min suhūlihā quṣūran watanḥitūnal jibāla buyūtā ۖ fadhkurū ālā-allāhi walā ta`thaw fil-arḍi mufsidīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسْتُضْعِفُوا۟ لِمَنْ ءَامَنَ مِنْهُمْ أَتَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ صَـٰلِحًا مُّرْسَلٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِۦ ۚ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرْسِلَ بِهِۦ مُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: The chiefs among the people who were arrogant towards the weaker ones among them who believed, asked: "Do you really know that Saleh has been sent by his Lord?" They said: "Indeed we believe in the message he has brought."
rows.transliteration: qālal-mala-ul ladhīnas-takbarū min qawmihi lilladhīnas-tuḍ`ifū liman āmana minhum ata`lamūna anna ṣāliḥan mursalun min rabbih ۚ qālū innā bimā ursila bihi mu-minūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوٓا۟ إِنَّا بِٱلَّذِىٓ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ كَـٰفِرُونَ
rows.translation: Those who were arrogant answered: "We do not believe in what you believe."
rows.transliteration: qālal ladhīnas-takbarū innā bil ladhī āmantum bihi kāfirūn

rows.arabic: فَعَقَرُوا۟ ٱلنَّاقَةَ وَعَتَوْا۟ عَنْ أَمْرِ رَبِّهِمْ وَقَالُوا۟ يَـٰصَـٰلِحُ ٱئْتِنَا بِمَا تَعِدُنَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْمُرْسَلِينَ
rows.translation: Then they hamstrung the she-camel and rebelled against the command of their Lord, and said: "Bring, O Saleh, on us the affliction you promise, if you are one of the sent ones."
rows.transliteration: fa`aqarun nāqata wa`ataw `an amri rabbihim waqālū yāṣāliḥu-tinā bimā ta`idunā in kunta minal mursalīn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
rows.translation: Then they were seized by an earthquake, and lay overturned on the ground in their homes in the morning.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhat-humur rajfatu fa-aṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīn

rows.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَالَةَ رَبِّى وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ وَلَـٰكِن لَّا تُحِبُّونَ ٱلنَّـٰصِحِينَ
rows.translation: Saleh turned away from them and said: "O my people, I conveyed to you the message of my Lord and warned you; but you do not like those who wish you well."
rows.transliteration: fatawallā `anhum waqāla yāqawmi laqad ablaghtukum risālata rabbī wanaṣaḥtu lakum walākin lā tuḥibbūnan nāṣiḥīn

rows.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ مَا سَبَقَكُم بِهَا مِنْ أَحَدٍ مِّنَ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And We sent Lot, who said to his people: "Why do you commit this lecherous act which none in the world has committed before?
rows.transliteration: walūṭan idh qāla liqawmihi ata-tūnal fāḥishata mā sabaqakum bihā min aḥadin minal `ālamīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ مُّسْرِفُونَ
rows.translation: In preference to women you satisfy your lust with men. Indeed you are a people who are guilty of excess."
rows.transliteration: innakum lata-tūnar rijāla shahwatan min dūnin nisā-i ۚ bal antum qawmun musrifūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ أَخْرِجُوهُم مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
rows.translation: His people made no answer, and only said: "Drive them out of the city. They profess to be pure."
rows.transliteration: wa mā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qālū akhrijūhum min qaryatikum ۖ innahum unāsun yataṭahharūn

rows.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ كَانَتْ مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
rows.translation: But We saved him and his family, except for his wife who was one of those who stayed behind.
rows.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa-ahlahu illam-ra-atahu kānat minal ghābirīn

rows.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: And We rained down on them a shower (of Stones). So witness the end of sinners!
rows.transliteration: wa-amṭarnā `alayhim maṭarā ۖ fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatul mujrimīn

rows.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ مَدْيَنَ أَخَاهُمْ شُعَيْبًا ۗ قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ مَا لَكُم مِّنْ إِلَـٰهٍ غَيْرُهُۥ ۖ قَدْ جَآءَتْكُم بَيِّنَةٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ ۖ فَأَوْفُوا۟ ٱلْكَيْلَ وَٱلْمِيزَانَ وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا۟ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشْيَآءَهُمْ وَلَا تُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بَعْدَ إِصْلَـٰحِهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَّكُمْ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: Remember, We sent to Midian their brother Shu'aib. "O you people," he said, "worship God, for you have no other god but He. Clear proof has come to you from your Lord; so give in full measure and full weight; do not keep back from people what is theirs, and do not corrupt the land after it has been reformed. This is best for you if you believe.
rows.transliteration: wa ilā madyana akhāhum shu`aybā ۗ qāla yāqawmi'-budullāha mā lakum min ilāhin ghayruh ۖ qad jā-at kum bayyinatun min rabbikum ۖ fa-awful kayla wal mīzāna walā tabkhasun nāsa ashyā-ahum walā tufsidū fil-arḍi ba`da iṣlāḥihā ۚ dhālikum khayrul lakum in kuntum mu-minīn

rows.arabic: وَلَا تَقْعُدُوا۟ بِكُلِّ صِرَٰطٍ تُوعِدُونَ وَتَصُدُّونَ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ مَنْ ءَامَنَ بِهِۦ وَتَبْغُونَهَا عِوَجًا ۚ وَٱذْكُرُوٓا۟ إِذْ كُنتُمْ قَلِيلًا فَكَثَّرَكُمْ ۖ وَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: Do not lie in ambush to intimidate and divert from the path of God those who believe in Him, nor seek obliquity in it. Remember the day when you were few and He increased your numbers. So consider the fate of those who were evil.
rows.transliteration: walā taq`udū bikulli ṣirāṭin tū`idūna wataṣuddūna `an sabīlillāhi man āmana bihi watabghūnahā `iwajā ۚ wadhkurū idh kuntum qalīlan fakathharakum ۖ wanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَإِن كَانَ طَآئِفَةٌ مِّنكُمْ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِٱلَّذِىٓ أُرْسِلْتُ بِهِۦ وَطَآئِفَةٌ لَّمْ يُؤْمِنُوا۟ فَٱصْبِرُوا۟ حَتَّىٰ يَحْكُمَ ٱللَّهُ بَيْنَنَا ۚ وَهُوَ خَيْرُ ٱلْحَـٰكِمِينَ
rows.translation: If some of you believe what has been sent through me, and some of you do not, have patience until God decide between us, for He is the best of all judges."
rows.transliteration: wa in kāna ṭā-ifatun minkum āmanū bil ladhī ursiltu bihi waṭā-ifatun lam yu-minū faṣbirū ḥattā yaḥkumallāhu baynanā ۚ wahuwa khayrul ḥākimīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لَنُخْرِجَنَّكَ يَـٰشُعَيْبُ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مَعَكَ مِن قَرْيَتِنَآ أَوْ لَتَعُودُنَّ فِى مِلَّتِنَا ۚ قَالَ أَوَلَوْ كُنَّا كَـٰرِهِينَ
rows.translation: The arrogant leaders of the people replied: "We shall drive you away from our land, O Shu'aib, and those who are with you, unless you come back to your faith." But he remarked: "Even if we are disgusted with it?
rows.transliteration: qālal-mala-ul ladhīnas-takbarū min qawmihi lanukhrijannaka yāshu`aybu wal ladhīna āmanū ma`aka min qaryatinā aw lata`ūdunna fī millatinā ۚ qāla awalaw kunnā kārihīn

rows.arabic: قَدِ ٱفْتَرَيْنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبًا إِنْ عُدْنَا فِى مِلَّتِكُم بَعْدَ إِذْ نَجَّىٰنَا ٱللَّهُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَمَا يَكُونُ لَنَآ أَن نَّعُودَ فِيهَآ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّنَا ۚ وَسِعَ رَبُّنَا كُلَّ شَىْءٍ عِلْمًا ۚ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَا ٱفْتَحْ بَيْنَنَا وَبَيْنَ قَوْمِنَا بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْفَـٰتِحِينَ
rows.translation: We shall only be guilty of blaspheming God if we accept your way after the people of Noah, and gave you a greater increase in your stature. So think of the favours of God; you may haply be blessed."
rows.transliteration: qadif-taraynā `alallāhi kadhiban in `udnā fī millatikum ba`da idh najjānallāhu minhā ۚ wa mā yakūnu lanā an na`ūda fīhā illā an yashā-allāhu rabbunā ۚ wasi`a rabbunā kulla shay-in `il-mā ۚ `alallāhi tawakkalnā ۚ rabbanaf-taḥ baynanā wabayna qawminā bil ḥaqqi wa-anta khayrul fātiḥīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا۟ مِن قَوْمِهِۦ لَئِنِ ٱتَّبَعْتُمْ شُعَيْبًا إِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَّخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: The chiefs among his people who did not believe said (to them): "If you follow Shu'aib and his way you will surely be ruined."
rows.transliteration: waqālal-mala-ul ladhīna kafarū min qawmihi la-init-taba`tum shu`ayban innakum idhal lakhāsirūn

rows.arabic: فَأَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ فَأَصْبَحُوا۟ فِى دَارِهِمْ جَـٰثِمِينَ
rows.translation: Then they were seized by an earthquake, and lay overturned on the ground in their homes in the morning.
rows.transliteration: fa-akhadhat-humur rajfatu fa-aṣbaḥū fī dārihim jāthimīn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ شُعَيْبًا كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا۟ فِيهَا ۚ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ شُعَيْبًا كَانُوا۟ هُمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: They who called Shu'aib a liar (disappeared) as though they had never existed; and those who called Shu'aib a liar were the ones who were ruined!
rows.transliteration: alladhīna kadhhabū shu`ayban ka-an lam yaghnaw fīhā ۚ alladhīna kadhhabū shu`ayban kānū humul khāsirīn

rows.arabic: فَتَوَلَّىٰ عَنْهُمْ وَقَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لَقَدْ أَبْلَغْتُكُمْ رِسَـٰلَـٰتِ رَبِّى وَنَصَحْتُ لَكُمْ ۖ فَكَيْفَ ءَاسَىٰ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ كَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: So Shu'aib turned away from them and said: "O people, I conveyed to you the message of my Lord, and warned you. (But you paid no heed). How can I grieve for a people who do not believe?"
rows.transliteration: fatawallā `anhum waqāla yāqawmi laqad ablaghtukum risālāti rabbī wanaṣaḥtu lakum ۖ fakayfa āsā `alā qawmin kāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَمَآ أَرْسَلْنَا فِى قَرْيَةٍ مِّن نَّبِىٍّ إِلَّآ أَخَذْنَآ أَهْلَهَا بِٱلْبَأْسَآءِ وَٱلضَّرَّآءِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَضَّرَّعُونَ
rows.translation: There is not a region to which We sent a prophet and did not inflict upon its people adversity and hardship so that they may submit.
rows.transliteration: wa mā arsalnā fī qaryatim min nabiyyin illā akhadhnā ahlahā bil ba-sā-i waḍ ḍarrā-i la`allahum yaḍḍarra`ūn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ بَدَّلْنَا مَكَانَ ٱلسَّيِّئَةِ ٱلْحَسَنَةَ حَتَّىٰ عَفَوا۟ وَّقَالُوا۟ قَدْ مَسَّ ءَابَآءَنَا ٱلضَّرَّآءُ وَٱلسَّرَّآءُ فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بَغْتَةً وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
rows.translation: But when We changed hardship to ease, and they rose and prospered, (they forgot Our favours) and said: "Our ancestors had also known suffering and joy." So We caught them unawares.
rows.transliteration: thumma baddalnā makānas sayyi-atil ḥasanata ḥattā `afaw waqālū qad massa ābā-anaḍ ḍarrā-u was sarrā-u fa-akhadhnāhum baghtatan wahum lā yash`urūn

rows.arabic: وَلَوْ أَنَّ أَهْلَ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَٱتَّقَوْا۟ لَفَتَحْنَا عَلَيْهِم بَرَكَـٰتٍ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَـٰكِن كَذَّبُوا۟ فَأَخَذْنَـٰهُم بِمَا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
rows.translation: But if the people of these regions had believed and feared God, We would surely have showered on them blessings of the heavens and the earth; but they only denied, and We punished them for their deeds.
rows.transliteration: walaw anna ahlal-qurā āmanū wattaqaw lafataḥnā `alayhim barakātin minas samā-i wal-arḍi walākin kadhhabū fa-akhadhnāhum bimā kānū yaksibūn

rows.arabic: أَفَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا بَيَـٰتًا وَهُمْ نَآئِمُونَ
rows.translation: Are the people of the region so secure that they lie asleep unaware as Our punishment overtakes them?
rows.transliteration: afa-amina ahlul qurā an ya-tiyahum ba-sunā bayātan wahum nā-imūn

rows.arabic: أَوَأَمِنَ أَهْلُ ٱلْقُرَىٰٓ أَن يَأْتِيَهُم بَأْسُنَا ضُحًى وَهُمْ يَلْعَبُونَ
rows.translation: Or, are the people of the towns so unafraid that (even when) Our retribution comes upon them in the hours of the morning they remain engrossed in sport and play?
rows.transliteration: awa-amina ahlul qurā an ya-tiyahum ba-sunā ḍuḥan wahum yal`abūn

rows.arabic: أَفَأَمِنُوا۟ مَكْرَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ فَلَا يَأْمَنُ مَكْرَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْقَوْمُ ٱلْخَـٰسِرُونَ
rows.translation: Can they remain secure against the plan of God? Only they feel secure against the plan of God who are certain of being ruined.
rows.transliteration: afa-aminū makrallāh ۚ falā ya-manu makrallāhi illal-qawmul khāsirūn

rows.arabic: أَوَلَمْ يَهْدِ لِلَّذِينَ يَرِثُونَ ٱلْأَرْضَ مِنۢ بَعْدِ أَهْلِهَآ أَن لَّوْ نَشَآءُ أَصَبْنَـٰهُم بِذُنُوبِهِمْ ۚ وَنَطْبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمْ فَهُمْ لَا يَسْمَعُونَ
rows.translation: Do not the people who inherited the earth from the (earlier) inhabitants perceive that We could afflict them too for their sins if We pleased, and put seals on their hearts that they may not hear (the voice of truth)?
rows.transliteration: awalam yahdi lilladhīna yarithūnal-arḍa min ba`di ahlihā an law nashā-u aṣabnāhum bidhunūbihim ۚ wanaṭba`u `alā qulūbihim fahum lā yasma`ūn

rows.arabic: تِلْكَ ٱلْقُرَىٰ نَقُصُّ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ أَنۢبَآئِهَا ۚ وَلَقَدْ جَآءَتْهُمْ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلْبَيِّنَـٰتِ فَمَا كَانُوا۟ لِيُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِمَا كَذَّبُوا۟ مِن قَبْلُ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يَطْبَعُ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلْكَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: These were the (earlier) habitations whose accounts We have given to you. Their apostles came with clear proofs, but they did not believe what they once denied. That is how God seals the hearts of those who do not believe.
rows.transliteration: tilkal qurā naquṣṣu `alayka min anbā-ihā ۚ walaqad jā-at hum rusuluhum bil bayyināti famā kānū liyu-minū bimā kadhhabū min qabl ۚ kadhālika yaṭba`ullāhu `alā qulūbil kāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَمَا وَجَدْنَا لِأَكْثَرِهِم مِّنْ عَهْدٍ ۖ وَإِن وَجَدْنَآ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَفَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: We did not find many of them faithful to their promises, and found many of them disobedient.
rows.transliteration: wa mā wajadnā li-aktharihim min `ahd ۖ wa in wajadnā aktharahum lafāsiqīn

rows.arabic: ثُمَّ بَعَثْنَا مِنۢ بَعْدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَمَلَإِي۟هِۦ فَظَلَمُوا۟ بِهَا ۖ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: So We sent Moses with miracles after (these apostles) to the Pharaoh and his nobles, but they behaved with them high-handedly. See then the end of the authors of evil.
rows.transliteration: thumma ba`athnā min ba`dihim mūsā bi-āyātinā ilā fir`awna wa mala-ihi faẓalamū bihā ۖ fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatul mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَـٰفِرْعَوْنُ إِنِّى رَسُولٌ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: Moses said: "O Pharaoh, I have been sent by the Lord of all the worlds;
rows.transliteration: waqāla mūsā yāfir`awnu innī rasūlun min rabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: حَقِيقٌ عَلَىٰٓ أَن لَّآ أَقُولَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ إِلَّا ٱلْحَقَّ ۚ قَدْ جِئْتُكُم بِبَيِّنَةٍ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ فَأَرْسِلْ مَعِىَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: "I am duty bound to speak nothing of God but the truth I have brought from your Lord a clear sign; so let the people of Israel depart with me."
rows.transliteration: ḥaqīqun `alā an lā aqūla `alallāhi illal-ḥaqq ۚ qad ji-tukum bibayyinatim min rabbikum fa-arsil ma`iya banī isrā-iyl

rows.arabic: قَالَ إِن كُنتَ جِئْتَ بِـَٔايَةٍ فَأْتِ بِهَآ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّـٰدِقِينَ
rows.translation: He said: "If you have brought a sign then display it, if what you say is true."
rows.transliteration: qāla in kunta ji-ta bi-āyatin fa-ti bihā in kunta minaṣ ṣādiqīn

rows.arabic: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِىَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُّبِينٌ
rows.translation: At this Moses threw down his staff, and lo, it became a live serpent.
rows.transliteration: fa-alqā `aṣāhu fa-idhā hiya thu`bānun mubīn

rows.arabic: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِىَ بَيْضَآءُ لِلنَّـٰظِرِينَ
rows.translation: And he drew forth his hand, and behold, it looked white to those who beheld it.
rows.transliteration: wanaza`a yadahu fa-idhā hiya bayḍā-u linnāẓirīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَسَـٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
rows.translation: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.
rows.transliteration: qālal-mala-u min qawmi fir`awna inna hādhā lasāḥirun `alīm

rows.arabic: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخْرِجَكُم مِّنْ أَرْضِكُمْ ۖ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
rows.translation: "He wishes to drive you away from the land. So what do you advise?"
rows.transliteration: yurīdu an yukhrijakum min arḍikum ۖ famādhā ta-murūn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَأَرْسِلْ فِى ٱلْمَدَآئِنِ حَـٰشِرِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "Put him and his brother off (awhile) and send out heralds to the cities
rows.transliteration: qālū arjih wa-akhāhu wa-arsil fil madā-ini ḥāshirīn

rows.arabic: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَـٰحِرٍ عَلِيمٍ
rows.translation: "To bring all the wise magicians to you."
rows.transliteration: ya-tūka bikulli sāḥirin `alīm

rows.arabic: وَجَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ فِرْعَوْنَ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحْنُ ٱلْغَـٰلِبِينَ
rows.translation: The magicians came to the Pharaoh and said: "Is there reward for us if we succeed?"
rows.transliteration: wajā-as saḥaratu fir`awna qālū inna lanā la-ajran in kunnā naḥnul ghālibīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ لَمِنَ ٱلْمُقَرَّبِينَ
rows.translation: "Yes," said he, "you will be among the honoured."
rows.transliteration: qāla na`am wa innakum laminal muqarrabīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِمَّآ أَن تُلْقِىَ وَإِمَّآ أَن نَّكُونَ نَحْنُ ٱلْمُلْقِينَ
rows.translation: So they said: "O Moses, you may cast your spell first, or we shall cast ours."
rows.transliteration: qālū yāmūsā immā an tulqiya wa immā an nakūna naḥnul mulqīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَلْقُوا۟ ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَلْقَوْا۟ سَحَرُوٓا۟ أَعْيُنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَٱسْتَرْهَبُوهُمْ وَجَآءُو بِسِحْرٍ عَظِيمٍ
rows.translation: "You cast it first," answered Moses. When they cast their spell, they bewitched the eyes of the people and petrified them by conjuring up a great charm.
rows.transliteration: qāla alqū ۖ falammā alqaw saḥarū a`yunan nāsi wastarhabūhum wajā-ū bisiḥrin `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنْ أَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۖ فَإِذَا هِىَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
rows.translation: We said to Moses: "Throw down your staff;" and it swallowed up their conjurations in no time.
rows.transliteration: wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā an alqi `aṣāk ۖ fa-idhā hiya talqafu mā ya-fikūn

rows.arabic: فَوَقَعَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَبَطَلَ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Thus the truth was upheld, and the falsehood that they practised was exposed.
rows.transliteration: fawaqa`al ḥaqqu wabaṭala mā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: فَغُلِبُوا۟ هُنَالِكَ وَٱنقَلَبُوا۟ صَـٰغِرِينَ
rows.translation: Thus there and then they were vanquished and overthrown, humiliated.
rows.transliteration: faghulibū hunālika wanqalabū ṣāghirīn

rows.arabic: وَأُلْقِىَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ سَـٰجِدِينَ
rows.translation: The sorcerers fell to the ground in homage,
rows.transliteration: wa-ulqiyas saḥaratu sājidīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ ءَامَنَّا بِرَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: And said: "We have come to believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
rows.transliteration: qālū āmannā birabbil `ālamīn

rows.arabic: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَـٰرُونَ
rows.translation: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
rows.transliteration: rabbi mūsā wahārūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ ءَامَنتُم بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَنْ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَمَكْرٌ مَّكَرْتُمُوهُ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ لِتُخْرِجُوا۟ مِنْهَآ أَهْلَهَا ۖ فَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: But Pharaoh said: "You have come to accept belief in Him without my permission! This surely is a plot you have hatched to expel the people from the land. You will soon come to know.
rows.transliteration: qāla fir`awnu āmantum bihi qabla an ādhana lakum ۖ inna hādhā lamakrun makartumūhu fil madīnati litukhrijū minhā ahlahā ۖ fasawfa ta`lamūn

rows.arabic: لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُم مِّنْ خِلَـٰفٍ ثُمَّ لَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
rows.translation: "I will have your hands and feet on alternate sides cut off, and have you all crucified."
rows.transliteration: la-uqaṭṭi`anna aydiyakum wa-arjulakum min khilāfin thumma la-uṣallibannakum ajma`īn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
rows.translation: They answered: "We have (in any case) to go back to our Lord.
rows.transliteration: qālū innā ilā rabbinā munqalibūn

rows.arabic: وَمَا تَنقِمُ مِنَّآ إِلَّآ أَنْ ءَامَنَّا بِـَٔايَـٰتِ رَبِّنَا لَمَّا جَآءَتْنَا ۚ رَبَّنَآ أَفْرِغْ عَلَيْنَا صَبْرًا وَتَوَفَّنَا مُسْلِمِينَ
rows.translation: "The only reason you have to hate us is that we believed in the signs of our Lord as they came to us. O our Lord, give us sufficient endurance that we may die submitting (to You)."
rows.transliteration: wa mā tanqimu minnā illā an āmannā bi-āyāti rabbinā lammā jā-at nā ۚ rabbanā afrigh `alaynā ṣabran watawaffanā muslimīn

rows.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلْمَلَأُ مِن قَوْمِ فِرْعَوْنَ أَتَذَرُ مُوسَىٰ وَقَوْمَهُۥ لِيُفْسِدُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَذَرَكَ وَءَالِهَتَكَ ۚ قَالَ سَنُقَتِّلُ أَبْنَآءَهُمْ وَنَسْتَحْىِۦ نِسَآءَهُمْ وَإِنَّا فَوْقَهُمْ قَـٰهِرُونَ
rows.translation: And the leaders of Pharaoh's people said to him: "Would you allow Moses and his people to create disorder in the land and discard you and your gods?" He replied: "We shall now slay their sons and spare their women, and subdue them."
rows.transliteration: waqālal-mala-u min qawmi fir`awna atadharu mūsā waqawmahu liyufsidū fil-arḍi wayadharaka wa-ālihatak ۚ qāla sanuqattilu abnā-ahum wanastaḥyī nisā-ahum wa innā fawqahum qāhirūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِقَوْمِهِ ٱسْتَعِينُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱصْبِرُوٓا۟ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلْأَرْضَ لِلَّهِ يُورِثُهَا مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِۦ ۖ وَٱلْعَـٰقِبَةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
rows.translation: Said Moses to his people: "Invoke the help of God and be firm. The earth belongs to God: He can make whom He wills among His creatures inherit it. The future is theirs who take heed for themselves."
rows.transliteration: qāla mūsā liqawmihis-ta`īnū billāhi waṣbirū ۖ innal-arḍa lillāhi yūrithuhā man yashā-u min `ibādih ۖ wal `āqibatu lil-muttaqīn

rows.arabic: قَالُوٓا۟ أُوذِينَا مِن قَبْلِ أَن تَأْتِيَنَا وَمِنۢ بَعْدِ مَا جِئْتَنَا ۚ قَالَ عَسَىٰ رَبُّكُمْ أَن يُهْلِكَ عَدُوَّكُمْ وَيَسْتَخْلِفَكُمْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَيَنظُرَ كَيْفَ تَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: They said: "We were oppressed before you came, and have been since you have come to us." He answered: "It may well be that soon God may destroy your enemy and make you inherit the land, and then see how you behave."
rows.transliteration: qālū ūdhīnā min qabli an ta-tiyanā wa min ba`di mā ji-tanā ۚ qāla `asā rabbukum an yuhlika `aduwwakum wayastakhlifakum fil-arḍi fayanẓura kayfa ta`malūn

rows.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَخَذْنَآ ءَالَ فِرْعَوْنَ بِٱلسِّنِينَ وَنَقْصٍ مِّنَ ٱلثَّمَرَٰتِ لَعَلَّهُمْ يَذَّكَّرُونَ
rows.translation: We afflicted the people of Pharaoh with famine and dearth of everything that they might take heed.
rows.transliteration: walaqad akhadhnā āla fir`awna bis sinīna wanaqṣin minath thamarāti la`allahum yadhhakkarūn

rows.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتْهُمُ ٱلْحَسَنَةُ قَالُوا۟ لَنَا هَـٰذِهِۦ ۖ وَإِن تُصِبْهُمْ سَيِّئَةٌ يَطَّيَّرُوا۟ بِمُوسَىٰ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥٓ ۗ أَلَآ إِنَّمَا طَـٰٓئِرُهُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
rows.translation: Yet when good came their way they said: "It is our due;" but when misfortune befell them they put the omen down to Moses and those who were with him. But surely the omen was with God, yet most of them did not understand.
rows.transliteration: fa-idhā jā-at humul ḥasanatu qālū lanā hādhih ۖ wa in tuṣibhum sayyi-atun yaṭṭayyarū bimūsā wa man ma`ah ۗ alā innamā ṭā-iruhum `indallāhi walākinna aktharahum lā ya`lamūn

rows.arabic: وَقَالُوا۟ مَهْمَا تَأْتِنَا بِهِۦ مِنْ ءَايَةٍ لِّتَسْحَرَنَا بِهَا فَمَا نَحْنُ لَكَ بِمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: They said: "Whatsoever the sign you have brought to deceive us, we shall not believe in you."
rows.transliteration: waqālū mahmā ta-tinā bihi min āyatin litas-ḥaranā bihā famā naḥnu laka bimu-minīn

rows.arabic: فَأَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلطُّوفَانَ وَٱلْجَرَادَ وَٱلْقُمَّلَ وَٱلضَّفَادِعَ وَٱلدَّمَ ءَايَـٰتٍ مُّفَصَّلَـٰتٍ فَٱسْتَكْبَرُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا مُّجْرِمِينَ
rows.translation: So We let loose on them floods and locusts, and vermin, frogs and blood -- how many different signs. But they still remained arrogant, for they were a people full of sin.
rows.transliteration: fa-arsalnā `alayhimuṭ ṭūfāna wal jarāda wal qummala waḍ ḍafādi`a wad dama āyātin mufaṣṣalātin fastakbarū wakānū qawman mujrimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا وَقَعَ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلرِّجْزُ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَى ٱدْعُ لَنَا رَبَّكَ بِمَا عَهِدَ عِندَكَ ۖ لَئِن كَشَفْتَ عَنَّا ٱلرِّجْزَ لَنُؤْمِنَنَّ لَكَ وَلَنُرْسِلَنَّ مَعَكَ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ
rows.translation: Yet when punishment overtook them, they said: "O Moses, invoke your Lord for us as you have been enjoined. If the torment is removed, we shall certainly believe in you and let the people of Israel go with you."
rows.transliteration: walammā waqa`a `alayhimur rijzu qālū yāmūsad-`u lanā rabbaka bimā `ahida `indak ۖ la-in kashafta `annar rijza lanu-minanna laka walanursilanna ma`aka banī isrā-iyl

rows.arabic: فَلَمَّا كَشَفْنَا عَنْهُمُ ٱلرِّجْزَ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍ هُم بَـٰلِغُوهُ إِذَا هُمْ يَنكُثُونَ
rows.translation: But no sooner was the punishment withdrawn for a time to enable them to make good their promise than they broke it.
rows.transliteration: falammā kashafnā `anhumur rijza ilā ajalin hum bālighūhu idhā hum yankuthūn

rows.arabic: فَٱنتَقَمْنَا مِنْهُمْ فَأَغْرَقْنَـٰهُمْ فِى ٱلْيَمِّ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا غَـٰفِلِينَ
rows.translation: So We took vengeance on them, and drowned them in the sea for rejecting Our signs and not heeding them.
rows.transliteration: fantaqamnā minhum fa-aghraqnāhum fil yammi bi-annahum kadhhabū bi-āyātinā wakānū `anhā ghāfilīn

rows.arabic: وَأَوْرَثْنَا ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَانُوا۟ يُسْتَضْعَفُونَ مَشَـٰرِقَ ٱلْأَرْضِ وَمَغَـٰرِبَهَا ٱلَّتِى بَـٰرَكْنَا فِيهَا ۖ وَتَمَّتْ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ ٱلْحُسْنَىٰ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا۟ ۖ وَدَمَّرْنَا مَا كَانَ يَصْنَعُ فِرْعَوْنُ وَقَوْمُهُۥ وَمَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْرِشُونَ
rows.translation: We then made the people who were weak (and oppressed) successors of the land to the East and the West which We had blessed. Thus the fair promise of your Lord to the children of Israel was fulfilled, for they were patient in adversity; and whatsoever the Pharaoh and his people had fashioned, and the structures they had raised, were destroyed.
rows.transliteration: wa-awrathnal qawmal ladhīna kānū yustaḍ`afūna mashāriqal-arḍi wa maghāribahal latī bāraknā fīhā ۖ watammat kalimatu rabbikal ḥusnā `alā banī isrā-iyla bimā ṣabarū ۖ wadammarnā mā kāna yaṣna`u fir`awnu waqawmuhu wa mā kānū ya`rishūn

rows.arabic: وَجَـٰوَزْنَا بِبَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلْبَحْرَ فَأَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ قَوْمٍ يَعْكُفُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَصْنَامٍ لَّهُمْ ۚ قَالُوا۟ يَـٰمُوسَى ٱجْعَل لَّنَآ إِلَـٰهًا كَمَا لَهُمْ ءَالِهَةٌ ۚ قَالَ إِنَّكُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
rows.translation: When We brought the children of Israel across the sea, and they came to a people who were devoted to their idols, they said: "O Moses, make us also a god like theirs." "You are ignorant," he replied.
rows.transliteration: wajāwaznā bibanī isrā-iylal-baḥra fa-ataw `alā qawmiy ya`kufūna `alā aṣnāmin lahum ۚ qālū yāmūsaj-`al lanā ilāhan kamā lahum ālihah ۚ qāla innakum qawmun tajhalūn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ مُتَبَّرٌ مَّا هُمْ فِيهِ وَبَـٰطِلٌ مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: "These people and their ways will surely be destroyed, for false is what they practise.
rows.transliteration: inna hā-ulā-i mutabbarun mā hum fīhi wabāṭilun mā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: قَالَ أَغَيْرَ ٱللَّهِ أَبْغِيكُمْ إِلَـٰهًا وَهُوَ فَضَّلَكُمْ عَلَى ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
rows.translation: "Do you want me to seek for you," he said, "a god other than God, when He has exalted you over all the nations of the world?
rows.transliteration: qāla aghayrallāhi abghīkum ilāhan wahuwa faḍḍalakum `alal-`ālamīn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ أَنجَيْنَـٰكُم مِّنْ ءَالِ فِرْعَوْنَ يَسُومُونَكُمْ سُوٓءَ ٱلْعَذَابِ ۖ يُقَتِّلُونَ أَبْنَآءَكُمْ وَيَسْتَحْيُونَ نِسَآءَكُمْ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكُم بَلَآءٌ مِّن رَّبِّكُمْ عَظِيمٌ
rows.translation: "Remember (the day) when He saved you from the people of Pharaoh who oppressed and afflicted you, and slew your sons and spared your women. In this was a great trial from your Lord."
rows.transliteration: wa idh anjaynākum min āli fir`awna yasūmūnakum sū al `adhāb ۖ yuqattilūna abnā-akum wayastaḥyūna nisā-akum ۚ wafī dhālikum balā-un min rabbikum `aẓīm

rows.arabic: وَوَٰعَدْنَا مُوسَىٰ ثَلَـٰثِينَ لَيْلَةً وَأَتْمَمْنَـٰهَا بِعَشْرٍ فَتَمَّ مِيقَـٰتُ رَبِّهِۦٓ أَرْبَعِينَ لَيْلَةً ۚ وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَخِيهِ هَـٰرُونَ ٱخْلُفْنِى فِى قَوْمِى وَأَصْلِحْ وَلَا تَتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
rows.translation: We made an appointment of thirty nights with Moses (On Mount Sinai) to which We added ten more; so the term set by the Lord was completed in forty nights. Moses said to Aaron, his brother: "Deputise for me among my people. Dispose rightly, and do not follow the way of the authors of evil."
rows.transliteration: wawā`adnā mūsā thalāthīna laylatan wa-atmamnāhā bi`ashrin fatamma mīqātu rabbihi arba`īna laylah ۚ waqāla mūsā li-akhīhi hārūnakh-lufnī fī qawmī wa-aṣliḥ walā tattabi` sabīlal-mufsidīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا جَآءَ مُوسَىٰ لِمِيقَـٰتِنَا وَكَلَّمَهُۥ رَبُّهُۥ قَالَ رَبِّ أَرِنِىٓ أَنظُرْ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ لَن تَرَىٰنِى وَلَـٰكِنِ ٱنظُرْ إِلَى ٱلْجَبَلِ فَإِنِ ٱسْتَقَرَّ مَكَانَهُۥ فَسَوْفَ تَرَىٰنِى ۚ فَلَمَّا تَجَلَّىٰ رَبُّهُۥ لِلْجَبَلِ جَعَلَهُۥ دَكًّا وَخَرَّ مُوسَىٰ صَعِقًا ۚ فَلَمَّآ أَفَاقَ قَالَ سُبْحَـٰنَكَ تُبْتُ إِلَيْكَ وَأَنَا۠ أَوَّلُ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
rows.translation: When Moses arrived at the appointed time and his Lord spoke to him, he said: "O Lord, reveal Yourself to me that I may behold You." "You cannot behold Me," He said. "But look at the mountain: If it remains firm in its place you may then behold Me." But when his Lord appeared on the mountain in His effulgence, it crumbled to a heap of dust, and Moses fell unconscious. When he came to, he said: "All glory to You. I turn to You in repentance, and I am the first to believe."
rows.transliteration: walammā jā-a mūsā limīqātinā wakallamahu rabbuhu qāla rabbi arinī anẓur ilayk ۚ qāla lan tarānī walākinin-ẓur ilal-jabali fa-inis-taqarra makānahu fasawfa tarānī ۚ falammā tajallā rabbuhu liljabali ja`alahu dakkan wakharra mūsā ṣa`iqā ۚ falammā afāqa qāla subḥānaka tubtu ilayka wa-ana awwalul mu-minīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنِّى ٱصْطَفَيْتُكَ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ بِرِسَـٰلَـٰتِى وَبِكَلَـٰمِى فَخُذْ مَآ ءَاتَيْتُكَ وَكُن مِّنَ ٱلشَّـٰكِرِينَ
rows.translation: Said (the Lord): "O Moses, I raised you above all men by sending My messages and speaking to you; so receive what I give you, and be grateful."
rows.transliteration: qāla yāmūsā inniṣ-ṭafaytuka `alan nāsi birisālātī wabikalāmī fakhudh mā ātaytuka wakun minash shākirīn

rows.arabic: وَكَتَبْنَا لَهُۥ فِى ٱلْأَلْوَاحِ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ مَّوْعِظَةً وَتَفْصِيلًا لِّكُلِّ شَىْءٍ فَخُذْهَا بِقُوَّةٍ وَأْمُرْ قَوْمَكَ يَأْخُذُوا۟ بِأَحْسَنِهَا ۚ سَأُو۟رِيكُمْ دَارَ ٱلْفَـٰسِقِينَ
rows.translation: And We wrote down on tablets admonitions and clear explanations of all things for Moses, and ordered him: "Hold fast to them, and command your people to observe the best in them. I will show you the abode of the wicked.
rows.transliteration: wakatabnā lahu fil-alwāḥi min kulli shay-in maw`iẓatan watafṣīlal likulli shay-in fakhudh-hā biquwwatin wa-mur qawmaka ya-khudhū bi-aḥsanihā ۚ sa-urīkum dāral fāsiqīn

rows.arabic: سَأَصْرِفُ عَنْ ءَايَـٰتِىَ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَكَبَّرُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ بِغَيْرِ ٱلْحَقِّ وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ كُلَّ ءَايَةٍ لَّا يُؤْمِنُوا۟ بِهَا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلرُّشْدِ لَا يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا وَإِن يَرَوْا۟ سَبِيلَ ٱلْغَىِّ يَتَّخِذُوهُ سَبِيلًا ۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَكَانُوا۟ عَنْهَا غَـٰفِلِينَ
rows.translation: I will turn those away from My signs who behave unjustly with arrogance in the land so that even though they see all the signs they will not believe in them; and if they see the path of rectitude, will not take it to be a way; and if they see the way of error take it to be the (right) path. This is so for they have called Our messages lies, and have been heedless of them."
rows.transliteration: sa-aṣrifu `an āyātiyal ladhīna yatakabbarūna fil-arḍi bighayril ḥaqqi wa in yaraw kulla āyatin lā yu-minū bihā wa in yaraw sabīlar rushdi lā yattakhidhūhu sabīlan wa in yaraw sabīlal-ghayyi yattakhidhūhu sabīlā ۚ dhālika bi-annahum kadhhabū bi-āyātinā wakānū `anhā ghāfilīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا وَلِقَآءِ ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ حَبِطَتْ أَعْمَـٰلُهُمْ ۚ هَلْ يُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُوا۟ يَعْمَلُونَ
rows.translation: Vain are the acts of those who deny Our signs and the meeting in the Hereafter. Can they ever be rewarded for anything but what they did?
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna kadhhabū bi-āyātinā waliqā-il-ākhirati ḥabiṭat a`māluhum ۚ hal yujzawna illā mā kānū ya`malūn

rows.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذَ قَوْمُ مُوسَىٰ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ مِنْ حُلِيِّهِمْ عِجْلًا جَسَدًا لَّهُۥ خُوَارٌ ۚ أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّهُۥ لَا يُكَلِّمُهُمْ وَلَا يَهْدِيهِمْ سَبِيلًا ۘ ٱتَّخَذُوهُ وَكَانُوا۟ ظَـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: In the absence of Moses his people prepared the image of a calf from their ornaments, which gave out the mooing of a cow. Yet they did not see it could neither speak to them nor guide them to the right path. Even then they took it (for a deity) and did wrong.
rows.transliteration: wattakhadha qawmu mūsā min ba`dihi min ḥuliyyihim `ijlan jasadal lahu khuwār ۚ alam yaraw annahu lā yukallimuhum walā yahdīhim sabīlā ۘ it-takhadhūhu wakānū ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا سُقِطَ فِىٓ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَرَأَوْا۟ أَنَّهُمْ قَدْ ضَلُّوا۟ قَالُوا۟ لَئِن لَّمْ يَرْحَمْنَا رَبُّنَا وَيَغْفِرْ لَنَا لَنَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلْخَـٰسِرِينَ
rows.translation: Then they were filled with remorse and saw that they had erred and said: "If our Lord does not forgive us we will surely be lost."
rows.transliteration: walammā suqiṭa fī aydīhim wara-aw annahum qad ḍallū qālū la-in lam yarḥamnā rabbunā wayaghfir lanā lanakūnanna minal khāsirīn

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا رَجَعَ مُوسَىٰٓ إِلَىٰ قَوْمِهِۦ غَضْبَـٰنَ أَسِفًا قَالَ بِئْسَمَا خَلَفْتُمُونِى مِنۢ بَعْدِىٓ ۖ أَعَجِلْتُمْ أَمْرَ رَبِّكُمْ ۖ وَأَلْقَى ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ وَأَخَذَ بِرَأْسِ أَخِيهِ يَجُرُّهُۥٓ إِلَيْهِ ۚ قَالَ ٱبْنَ أُمَّ إِنَّ ٱلْقَوْمَ ٱسْتَضْعَفُونِى وَكَادُوا۟ يَقْتُلُونَنِى فَلَا تُشْمِتْ بِىَ ٱلْأَعْدَآءَ وَلَا تَجْعَلْنِى مَعَ ٱلْقَوْمِ ٱلظَّـٰلِمِينَ
rows.translation: When Moses returned to his people, indignant and grieved, he said: "How wickedly you behaved in my absence. Why must you hasten the decree of your Lord?" And he cast aside the tablets, and pulled his brother by the hair. "O son of my mother," said (Aaron), "these people took advantage of my weakness and almost killed me. Do not let my enemies rejoice at my plight, and do not put me down among transgressors."
rows.transliteration: walammā raja`a mūsā ilā qawmihi ghaḍbāna asifan qāla bi-samā khalaftumūnī min ba`dī ۖ a`ajiltum amra rabbikum ۖ wa-alqal-alwāḥa wa-akhadha bira-si akhīhi yajurruhu ilayh ۚ qālab-na umma innal qawmas-taḍ`afūnī wakādū yaqtulūnanī falā tushmit biyal-a`dā-a walā taj`alnī ma`al qawmiẓ ẓālimīn

rows.arabic: قَالَ رَبِّ ٱغْفِرْ لِى وَلِأَخِى وَأَدْخِلْنَا فِى رَحْمَتِكَ ۖ وَأَنتَ أَرْحَمُ ٱلرَّٰحِمِينَ
rows.translation: (Moses) said: "O Lord, forgive me and my brother, and admit us to Your grace, for You are the most compassionate of all."
rows.transliteration: qāla rabbigh-fir lī wali-akhī wa-adkhilnā fī raḥmatik ۖ wa-anta arḥamur rāḥimīn

rows.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّخَذُوا۟ ٱلْعِجْلَ سَيَنَالُهُمْ غَضَبٌ مِّن رَّبِّهِمْ وَذِلَّةٌ فِى ٱلْحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنْيَا ۚ وَكَذَٰلِكَ نَجْزِى ٱلْمُفْتَرِينَ
rows.translation: Surely those who have taken the calf (as a god) will suffer the anger of their Lord, and disgrace in the world. That is how We requite those who fabricate lies.
rows.transliteration: innal ladhīnat-takhadhul `ijla sayanāluhum ghaḍabun min rabbihim wadhillatun fil ḥayātid dunyā ۚ wakadhālika najzil muftarīn

rows.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ عَمِلُوا۟ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ ثُمَّ تَابُوا۟ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا وَءَامَنُوٓا۟ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ مِنۢ بَعْدِهَا لَغَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
rows.translation: Yet those who do wrong, then repent and believe, are forgiven, for your Lord is forgiving and kind.
rows.transliteration: wal ladhīna `amilus sayyi-āti thumma tābū min ba`dihā wa-āmanū inna rabbaka min ba`dihā laghafūrun raḥīm

rows.arabic: وَلَمَّا سَكَتَ عَن مُّوسَى ٱلْغَضَبُ أَخَذَ ٱلْأَلْوَاحَ ۖ وَفِى نُسْخَتِهَا هُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلَّذِينَ هُمْ لِرَبِّهِمْ يَرْهَبُونَ
rows.translation: When his anger subsided Moses picked up the tablets. Inscribed on them was guidance and grace for those who fear their Lord.
rows.transliteration: walammā sakata `an mūsal ghaḍabu akhadhal-alwāḥ ۖ wafī nuskhatihā hudan waraḥmatun lilladhīna hum lirabbihim yarhabūn

rows.arabic: وَٱخْتَارَ مُوسَىٰ قَوْمَهُۥ سَبْعِينَ رَجُلًا لِّمِيقَـٰتِنَا ۖ فَلَمَّآ أَخَذَتْهُمُ ٱلرَّجْفَةُ قَالَ رَبِّ لَوْ شِئْتَ أَهْلَكْتَهُم مِّن قَبْلُ وَإِيَّـٰىَ ۖ أَتُهْلِكُنَا بِمَا فَعَلَ ٱلسُّفَهَآءُ مِنَّآ ۖ إِنْ هِىَ إِلَّا فِتْنَتُكَ تُضِلُّ بِهَا مَن تَشَآءُ وَتَهْدِى مَن تَشَآءُ ۖ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا فَٱغْفِرْ لَنَا وَٱرْحَمْنَا ۖ وَأَنتَ خَيْرُ ٱلْغَـٰفِرِينَ
rows.translation: Moses chose seventy of his people for the appointment (on Mount Sinai). When they arrived they were seized by a tremor. (Moses) said: "O Lord, if You had so pleased You could have annihilated them and me before this. Will You destroy us for something the foolish among us have done? This is but a trial from You whereby You will lead whom You will astray and guide whom You please. You are our saviour, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the best of forgivers.
rows.transliteration: wakhtāra mūsā qawmahu sab`īna rajulal limīqātinā ۖ falammā akhadhat-humur rajfatu qāla rabbi law shi-ta ahlaktahum min qablu wa iyyāy ۖ atuhlikunā bimā fa`alas sufahā-u minnā ۖ in hiya illā fitnatuka tuḍillu bihā man tashā-u watahdī man tashā-u ۖ anta waliyyunā faghfir lanā warḥamnā ۖ wa-anta khayrul ghāfirīn

rows.arabic: وَٱكْتُبْ لَنَا فِى هَـٰذِهِ ٱلدُّنْيَا حَسَنَةً وَفِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ إِنَّا هُدْنَآ إِلَيْكَ ۚ قَالَ عَذَابِىٓ أُصِيبُ بِهِۦ مَنْ أَشَآءُ ۖ وَرَحْمَتِى وَسِعَتْ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ فَسَأَكْتُبُهَا لِلَّذِينَ يَتَّقُونَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَٱلَّذِينَ هُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا يُؤْمِنُونَ
rows.translation: Enjoin for us good in the world, and good in the world to come. We turn to You alone." And the Lord said: "I punish only those whom I will, but My mercy enfolds everything. I shall enjoin it for those who take heed for themselves, who pay the zakat and believe in My signs,
rows.transliteration: waktub lanā fī hādhihid dunyā ḥasanatan wafil-ākhirati innā hudnā ilayk ۚ qāla `adhābī uṣību bihi man ashā-u ۖ waraḥmatī wasi`at kulla shay-ī ۚ fasa-aktubuhā lilladhīna yattaqūna wayu-tūnaz zakāta wal ladhīna hum bi-āyātinā yu-minūn

rows.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَتَّبِعُونَ ٱلرَّسُولَ ٱلنَّبِىَّ ٱلْأُمِّىَّ ٱلَّذِى يَجِدُونَهُۥ مَكْتُوبًا عِندَهُمْ فِى ٱلتَّوْرَىٰةِ وَٱلْإِنجِيلِ يَأْمُرُهُم بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَيَنْهَىٰهُمْ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَيُحِلُّ لَهُمُ ٱلطَّيِّبَـٰتِ وَيُحَرِّمُ عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْخَبَـٰٓئِثَ وَيَضَعُ عَنْهُمْ إِصْرَهُمْ وَٱلْأَغْلَـٰلَ ٱلَّتِى كَانَتْ عَلَيْهِمْ ۚ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ بِهِۦ وَعَزَّرُوهُ وَنَصَرُوهُ وَٱتَّبَعُوا۟ ٱلنُّورَ ٱلَّذِىٓ أُنزِلَ مَعَهُۥٓ ۙ أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلْمُفْلِحُونَ
rows.translation: Who follow the messenger, the gentile Prophet, described in the Torah and the Gospel, who bids things noble and forbids things vile, makes lawful what is clean, and prohibits what is foul, who relieves them of their burdens, and the yoke that lies upon them. Those who believe and honour and help him, and follow the light sent with him, are those who will attain their goal."
rows.transliteration: alladhīna yattabi`ūnar rasūlan nabiyyal-ummiyyal ladhī yajidūnahu maktūban `indahum fit tawrāti wal-injīli ya-muruhum bil ma`rūfi wayanhāhum `anil munkari wayuḥillu lahumuṭ ṭayyibāti wayuḥarrimu `alayhimul khabā-itha wayaḍa`u `anhum iṣrahum wal-aghlālal latī kānat `alayhim ۚ fal ladhīna āmanū bihi wa`azzarūhu wanaṣarūhu wattaba`un nūral ladhī unzila ma`ahu ulā-ika humul mufliḥūn

rows.arabic: قُلْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنِّى رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ إِلَيْكُمْ جَمِيعًا ٱلَّذِى لَهُۥ مُلْكُ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۖ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ يُحْىِۦ وَيُمِيتُ ۖ فَـَٔامِنُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ٱلنَّبِىِّ ٱلْأُمِّىِّ ٱلَّذِى يُؤْمِنُ بِٱللَّهِ وَكَلِمَـٰتِهِۦ وَٱتَّبِعُوهُ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَهْتَدُونَ
rows.translation: Say: "O men, I am verily the apostle of God to you all. His whose kingdom extends over the heavens and the earth. There is no god but He, the giver of life and death. So believe in God and the messenger, the gentile Prophet, sent by Him, who believes in God and His messages. Obey him; you may haply be guided aright."
rows.transliteration: qul yā-ayyuhan nāsu innī rasūlullāhi ilaykum jamī`anil ladhī lahu mulkus samāwāti wal-arḍ ۖ lā ilāha illā huwa yuḥyī wayumīt ۖ fa-āminū billāhi warasūlihin nabiyyil-ummiyyil ladhī yu-minu billāhi wakalimātihi wattabi`ūhu la`allakum tahtadūn

rows.arabic: وَمِن قَوْمِ مُوسَىٰٓ أُمَّةٌ يَهْدُونَ بِٱلْحَقِّ وَبِهِۦ يَعْدِلُونَ
rows.translation: Among the people of Moses is a section that shows the way to the truth, and deals justly in accordance with it.
rows.transliteration: wa min qawmi mūsā ummatun yahdūna bil ḥaqqi wabihi ya`dilūn

rows.arabic: وَقَطَّعْنَـٰهُمُ ٱثْنَتَىْ عَشْرَةَ أَسْبَاطًا أُمَمًا ۚ وَأَوْحَيْنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ إِذِ ٱسْتَسْقَىٰهُ قَوْمُهُۥٓ أَنِ ٱضْرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلْحَجَرَ ۖ فَٱنۢبَجَسَتْ مِنْهُ ٱثْنَتَا عَشْرَةَ عَيْنًا ۖ قَدْ عَلِمَ كُلُّ أُنَاسٍ مَّشْرَبَهُمْ ۚ وَظَلَّلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْغَمَـٰمَ وَأَنزَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلْمَنَّ وَٱلسَّلْوَىٰ ۖ كُلُوا۟ مِن طَيِّبَـٰتِ مَا رَزَقْنَـٰكُمْ ۚ وَمَا ظَلَمُونَا وَلَـٰكِن كَانُوٓا۟ أَنفُسَهُمْ يَظْلِمُونَ
rows.translation: We divided them into twelve (different) tribes. When his people asked for water, We said to Moses: "Strike the rock with your staff;" and behold, twelve springs of water gushed forth, so that each of the tribes had a place of its own to drink; and We made the clouds spread shade over them and sent for them manna and quails (and said): "Eat of the good things We have provided for you." But (by disobeying) they did not harm Us, they harmed themselves.
rows.transliteration: waqaṭṭa`nāhumuth-natay `ashrata asbāṭan umamā ۚ wa-awḥaynā ilā mūsā idhis-tasqāhu qawmuhu aniḍ-rib bi`aṣākal ḥajar ۖ fanbajasat minhuth-natā `ashrata `aynā ۖ qad `alima kullu unāsin mashrabahum ۚ waẓallalnā `alayhimul ghamāma wa-anzalnā `alayhimul manna was salwā ۖ kulū min ṭayyibāti mā razaqnākum ۚ wa mā ẓalamūnā walākin kānū anfusahum yaẓlimūn

rows.arabic: وَإِذْ قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱسْكُنُوا۟ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْقَرْيَةَ وَكُلُوا۟ مِنْهَا حَيْثُ شِئْتُمْ وَقُولُوا۟ حِطَّةٌ وَٱدْخُلُوا۟ ٱلْبَابَ سُجَّدًا نَّغْفِرْ لَكُمْ خَطِيٓـَٔـٰتِكُمْ ۚ سَنَزِيدُ ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ
